questions.question: graduation date
questions.answer: Thursday, May 23 at 8 pm at the Aurora Veterans Stadium

questions.question: high honor roll
questions.answer: High Honor Roll will be awarded when a student earns a GPA of 4.0 or above for a nine-week grading period.

questions.question: honor roll
questions.answer: Honor Roll status is awarded when a student earns a grade point average of 3.5 to 3.99 for a nine-week grade period

questions.question: merit roll
questions.answer: Merit Roll status is awarded when a student earns a grade point average of 3.00 to 3.49 for a nine-week grading period.

questions.question: graduation requirements
questions.answer:
English: 4 credits (core courses only, no electives)
Social Studies: 3 credits (core courses only, no electives, and including 1 credit of U.S.History and 1 credit of U.S. Government)
Mathematics: 4 credits (including 1 credit of Algebra II or Algebra II equivalent)
Science: 3 credits (including one credit of Physical Science or Chemistry and 1 credit of Biology)
Health: Â½ credit
Physical Education: Â½ credit
Financial Literacy: Â½ credit
Electives: See the AHS Program of Studies for details.
TOTAL:  21 CREDITS
In addition, students must pass all requirements of state mandated testing or state alternative pathways to graduation.
